title.narrative: SECOND MINING SECTOR CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT

description.narrative: The objective of the project is to strengthen the Recipient's capacity to manage national mineral sector activities in an environmentally, socially and economically sustainable manner.

condition.narrative: (a) The Borrower shall maintain or cause to be maintained afinancial management system, including records and accounts andprepare financialstatements in a format acceptable to IDA
For all expenditures maintain records and accounts, retain, until at least one year after the Association has receivedthe auditreport for the fiscal year
The first Financial Monitoring Report shall be furnished to theAssociation not later than 45 days after the end of the firstcalendar quarter after theEffective Date
each FinancialMonitoring Report shall be furnished to the Association not later than 45 days after eachsubsequent calendarquarter, and shall cover such calendar quarter.
the Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Association aFinancial Monitoring Report, in form and substance satisfactory tothe Association,

title.narrative: M&E Database established for tracking of socio-economic indicators in mining areas

comment.narrative: To be completed with 3 annual data-sets by project close

title.narrative: Mining Sector Monitoring System reports on regularly: (i) Increase in average annual investment in the mining sector, (ii) Increase in average annual mineral exports

comment.narrative: Values were reassessed in 2011 at the peak of commodity prices. As a consequence, export target set too high. (production hasincreased but sales value declined)
Training plans in progress to achieve target. Micro-projects are greatly exceeding target
Average 15 beneficiaries per micro project: 80 microprojects * 15 persons = 1,200 beneficiaries

title.narrative: Publication of geo-data and hydsrological data

actual.value: No on-line access. Data access on walk-in basisi only

title.narrative: Communes/villages participating in micro project program and/or local investment
% of operators annually reporting to central compliance database on performance standards (Environment, social, operational, fiscal)

comment.narrative: Reporting system is under development. 15 operators expected to be reporting by project close (i.e. 30% of operators)

title.narrative: Time required to process a mining title by the Mining Cadastre

target.value: In compliance with national law (30 days)

title.narrative: Railway and harbor facilities in NW Mauritania available to regional economic operators by midterm review
Increase in % in household income in areas where local economic development activities are implemented

comment.narrative: Final survey to be conducted before project close.The survey conducted on late 2012 reveals a 6% annual growth rate of HH income.This is markedly higher than the annual average over the same period.

title.narrative: Decision by private companies to proceed with the development of two new mines before project closure

baseline.value: development of Tasiast and Akjoujt mines, achievement of PRISM

target.value: 2 new mining projects in exploration stages, and Tasiast-Akjoujt movingto produc tion stage

title.narrative: Hydrocarbons Law and regulation have been revised in line with international practice

actual.value: Code of hydrocarbons approved by the National Assembly.Regulaion (decree) prepared and approved.

title.narrative: Petroleum cadastre established and fully functional 18 months after effectiveness of the AF
Strategic Environmental Assessment for petroleum to be completed within 12 months of effectiveness of AF

comment.narrative: The activity is now financed separately through the PGI

title.narrative: Sector Databank and Information Systems for petroleum have been established within 30 months of effectiveness of AF

target.value: Databank functional to capture petro-related information

actual.value: Databank designed and to be installed before project close

title.narrative: Environmental regulations for petroleum sector management have been prepared with participation of sector stakeholders and are effective

baseline.value: No environmental regulation specific to the petroleum sector

title.narrative: Environmental Unit at the Ministry in charge of petroleum to be created 9 months after effectiveness

baseline.value: No unit is solely dedicated to environment

title.narrative: Production Sharing Contract model to be applied to new petroleum permits has been revised and modernized

baseline.value: PSA not in line with current practice

actual.value: Yes - Revised PSA approved by government

comment.narrative: New batch of lecturers completing training in September

title.narrative: Micro projects completed under the small grants program

target.value: Full program developed for academic and technical studies

title.narrative: Regulatory framework established for autonomy of School of Mines
